raw_mentions:
In certain embodiments, an antibody that binds sirpβ1 has a dissociation constant (KD) of <1 μΜ, <100nM, <10nM, <1nM, <0.1nM, <0.01nM, or <0.001nM (e.g., 10 ^{-8} M or less, e.g., 10 ^{-8} M to 10 ^{-13} M, e.g., 10 ^{-9} M to 10 ^{-13} M).
The term "specifically binds" or "is specific for" a particular polypeptide or an epitope on a particular polypeptide target, as used herein, may be exhibited, for example, by a molecule against the target having a KD in the range of about 10 ^{-4} M or less, 10 ^{-5} M or less, 10 ^{-6} M or less, 10 ^{-7} M or less, 10 ^{-8} M or less, 10 ^{-9} M or less, 10 ^{-10} M or less, 10 ^{-11} M or less, 10 ^{-12} M or less, any one of KD 10 ^{-4} M to 10 ^{-6} M or 10 ^{-6} M to 10 ^{-10} M or 10 ^{-7} M to 10 ^{-9} M.

In some embodiments of any of the antibodies provided herein, the antibody has a dissociation constant (K <sub>D</sub>) of <1 μΜ, <100nM, <10nM, <1nM, <0.1nM, <0.01nM, or <0.001nM (e.g., 10 <sup>-8</sup> M or less, e.g., 10 <sup>-8</sup> M to 10 <sup>-13</sup> M, e.g., 10 <sup>-9</sup> M to 10 <sup>-</sup><sup>13</sup> M).

There are no sentences that meet the specified criteria. The text does not contain specific molecule names, IDs, or identifiers along with bioactivity metrics (IC50, Ki, Kd, EC50), numeric values, and units.

Here are the extracted sentences:

For these selections, the first round of selection utilized MILTENYI MACS beads and was labeled with 10nM human SIRP beta 1-Fc fusion antigen.
The first round used 100nM human SIRP beta 1 monomer antigen.
The last two rounds utilized human sirpβ1 monomer titration (100 nM,10nM, and 1 nM) to select the highest affinity binders, 100nM human sirpα monomer, and competition with control AM4-5 antibody that binds sirpβ1IgV domain to assess competitor representatives in the enriched population.
For affinity binding measurements, igG-loaded sensors were exposed to 100nM antigen (human sirpa domain 1 (D1) Fc fusion or sirpa domain 1 (D1) Fc fusion) for 3 minutes, then transferred to assay buffer for 3 minutes for dissociation rate measurement.
Additional affinity binding was determined by loading biotinylated sirpβ1 monomer onto the SA sensor and exposing 100nM IgG in solution.
Monovalent binding measurements were obtained by loading human sirpa-or sirpβ1-Fc fusion antigen onto an AHQ sensor followed by exposure to 100nM anti-sirpβ1 antibody Fab.
Additional monovalent measurements were made by loading biotinylated human sirpa or sirpβ1 monomers onto the SA sensor followed by exposure to 100nM Fab in solution.

There are no sentences that contain all four required components: a specific molecule name, ID or other identifier, a bioactivity metric (IC50, Ki, Kd, EC50 and their variations), a specific numeric value for that metric, and a unit for that value. The text primarily discusses methods and results related to antibody binding and cell assays without providing specific bioactivity metrics with numeric values and units.

Here are the extracted sentences:

For MSD-SET K <sub>D</sub> measurements, solution Equilibration Titration (SET) was performed in pbs+0.1% IgG free BSA (PBSF) with recombinant human sirpβ1, kept constant at 100pM and incubated with 3 to 5-fold serial dilutions of antibodies, starting at around 50 nM.
Apparent K <sub>D</sub> values were determined by nonlinear curve fitting (improvement OneSiteTotal, graph Pad Prism).
Antibodies (20 nM, in PBS) were coated onto standard binding MSD-ECL plates at 4℃overnight or at room temperature for 30 min.
osing 100nM IgG in solution.
Monovalent binding measurements were obtained by loading human sirpβ1Fc fusion antigen onto an AHQ sensor followed by exposure to 100nM anti-sirpβ1 antibody Fab.
Additional monovalent measurements were made by loading biotinylated human sirpβ1 monomers onto the SA sensor followed by exposure to 100nM Fab in solution.

The EC50 values for SB-8 and SB-8-13 were 0.022nM and 0.019nM, respectively.
